page.title: 18HISTORIC HOUSE / ANIMALS
page.content: THE MAIN PLACE OF HISTORIC INTEREST IN THE AREA IS HOLDENBY HOUSE, WHICH TODAY IS ONLY ONE EIGHTH OF ITS ORIGINAL SIZE. IT WAS BUILT BY SIR CHRISTOPHER HATTON IN I583. THE PRESENT OWNER IS JOHN LOWTHER WHOSE FAMILY HAVE OCCUPIED THE HOUSE FOR OVER 2OO YEARS. IN COMMON WITH MANY OTHER LARGE HISTORIC HOUSES HOLDENBY HAS HAD TO BE OPENED TO THE PUBLIC.AN ELIZABETHAN GARDEN WAS REPLANTED IN I98I AND IS VERY POPULAR. COURSES FOR SCHOOLS ARE RUN DURING TERM TIME WHEN CHILDREN CAN VISIT THE MANY RARE BREEDS OF ANIMALS PRESERVED THERE AMONGST THEM ARE MANX LOGTHAN SHEEP,WHITE PARK CATTLE AND RARE PIGS. THE HOUSE HAS BEEN THE VENUE FOR SEVERAL T.V. PLAYS AND WAS FEATURED IN THE BIGGLES FILMS.
